Package dev.gamekit.core

package dev.gamekit.core
  • Class
    Description
    Application
    Application is the heart of a GameKit program.
    Audio
    Audio handles loading and playback of sounds in GameKit
    Camera
    Camera controls which part of the game world is visible in the Window.
    Component
    While an Entity can have all functionality written entirely in its own class, it's usually a good idea to separate independent functionality from each other, and this is where components come in.
    Constants
    Constants store for engine
    Entity
    Entity represents objects that exist in the game world.
    Input
    Input handles keyboard and mouse input detection for use in the application.
    IO
    IO handles resource access
    Physics
    Physics handles updates of the World object on the main application thread
    Physics.CollisionListener
    Callback interface for physics world collisions
    Renderer
    Renderer dispatches draw calls which are processed by the render thread to draw on the current Window
    Scene
    Scene represents a logical part of your game.
    UI
    UI manages the user interface within a Scene
    Window
    Window which manages the JFrame and image buffers the application is rendered in
    Window.Info
    Window.Info holds the read-only parameters of the current instance
